name: Tilia europa

Head: NEURALGIA , WITH VEIL BEFORE EYES
Confusion, with dimness of vision
Much sneezing, with fluent coryza
Bleeding from nose
Modalities: Worse: in afternoon and evening; in warm room
Eyes: Sensation as of gauze before eyes
Female: INTENSE SORE FEELING ABOUT UTERUS; bearing-down, with hot sweat, but without relief
Soreness and redness of external genitals
Pelvic inflammation, tympanites, abdominal tenderness and hot sweat which does not relieve
Skin: Violent itching, and burning like fire after scratching
Eruption of small, red itching pimples
SWEAT WARM AND PROFUSE soon after falling asleep
Sweat increases as rheumatic pains increase

details: Of value in muscular weakness of the eye; hemorrhage to thin, pale blood. Puerperal metritis. Disease of the antrum. (KALI HYD.; CHELID.)
